MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus AudiofocusGain = (1)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.AudioFocus enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: Used to indicate a gain of audio focus, or a request of audio focus, of unknown duration.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus AudiofocusGainTransient = (2)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.AudioFocus enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: Used to indicate a temporary gain or request of audio focus, anticipated to last a short amount of time.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus AudiofocusGainTransientExclusive = (4)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.AudioFocus enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: Used to indicate a temporary request of audio focus, anticipated to last a short amount of time, during which no other applications, or system components, should play anything.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus AudiofocusGainTransientMayDuck = (3)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.AudioFocus enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: Used to indicate a temporary request of audio focus, anticipated to last a short amount of time, and where it is acceptable for other audio applications to keep playing after having lowered their output level (also referred to as "ducking").

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus AudiofocusLoss = (-1)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.AudioFocus enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: Used to indicate a loss of audio focus of unknown duration.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus AudiofocusLossTransient = (-2)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.AudioFocus enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: Used to indicate a transient loss of audio focus.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus AudiofocusLossTransientCanDuck = (-3)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.AudioFocus enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: Used to indicate a transient loss of audio focus where the loser of the audio focus can lower its output volume if it wants to continue playing (also referred to as "ducking"), as the new focus owner doesn't require others to be silent.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus AudiofocusNone = (0)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.AudioFocus enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: Used to indicate no audio focus has been gained or lost, or requested.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocusRequest AudiofocusRequestDelayed = (2)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.AudioFocusRequest enum directly instead of this field.", true)

Docs.summary: A focus change request whose granting is delayed: the request was successful, but the requester will only be granted audio focus once the condition that prevented immediate granting has ended.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocusRequest AudiofocusRequestGranted = (1)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Media.AudioFocusRequest enum directly instead of this field.", true)

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual float GetStreamVolumeDb (Android.Media.Stream streamType, int index, int deviceType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance float32 GetStreamVolumeDb(valuetype Android.Media.Stream streamType, int32 index, int32 deviceType) cil managed

Docs.param: stream type for which the volume is queried.
the volume index for which the volume is queried. The index value must be between the minimum and maximum index values for the given stream type (see and ).
the type of audio output device for which volume is queried.
Docs.summary: Returns the volume in dB (decibel) for the given stream type at the given volume index, on the given type of audio output device.
Docs.returns: a volume expressed in dB. A negative value indicates the audio signal is attenuated. A typical maximum value at the maximum volume index is 0 dB (no attenuation nor amplification). Muting is reflected by a value of .

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void PlaySoundEffect (Android.Media.SoundEffect effectType, float volume);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void PlaySoundEffect(valuetype Android.Media.SoundEffect effectType, float32 volume) cil managed
abstract member PlaySoundEffect : Android.Media.SoundEffect * single -> unit override this.PlaySoundEffect : Android.Media.SoundEffect * single -> unit

Docs.param: The type of sound effect. One of , , , , , , , , , , NOTE: This version uses the UI settings to determine whether sounds are heard or not.

Sound effect volume. The volume value is a raw scalar so UI controls should be scaled logarithmically. If a volume of -1 is specified, the AudioManager.STREAM_MUSIC stream volume minus 3dB will be used. NOTE: This version is for applications that have their own settings panel for enabling and controlling volume.
Docs.summary: Plays a sound effect (Key clicks, lid open/close.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Media.AudioFocusRequest RequestAudioFocus (Android.Media.AudioManager.IOnAudioFocusChangeListener l, Android.Media.Stream streamType, Android.Media.AudioFocus durationHint);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocusRequest RequestAudioFocus(class Android.Media.AudioManager/IOnAudioFocusChangeListener l, valuetype Android.Media.Stream streamType, valuetype Android.Media.AudioFocus durationHint) cil managed

abstract member RequestAudioFocus : Android.Media.AudioManager.IOnAudioFocusChangeListener * Android.Media.Stream * Android.Media.AudioFocus -> Android.Media.AudioFocusRequest override this.RequestAudioFocus : Android.Media.AudioManager.IOnAudioFocusChangeListener * Android.Media.Stream * Android.Media.AudioFocus -> Android.Media.AudioFocusRequest

Docs.param: the listener to be notified of audio focus changes
the main audio stream type affected by the focus request

use to indicate this focus request is temporary, and focus will be abandonned shortly. Examples of transient requests are for the playback of driving directions, or notifications sounds. Use to indicate also that it's ok for the previous focus owner to keep playing if it ducks its audio output. Alternatively use for a temporary request that benefits from the system not playing disruptive sounds like notifications, for usecases such as voice memo recording, or speech recognition. Use for a focus request of unknown duration such as the playback of a song or a video.
Docs.summary: Request audio focus.
Docs.returns:
, or .
Note that the return value is never when focus is requested without building the with set to true.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
